info.title: OnceHub API
info.description: The OnceHub API allows you to manage bookings, calendars, users, and other scheduling resources programmatically.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Validate API credentials and manage authentication for OnceHub API access. All API requests require an API key to be passed in the `API-Key` header.

tags.name: Bookings
tags.description:
Manage booking appointments and their lifecycle. Bookings represent scheduled meetings 
between contacts and users. Use these endpoints to list, retrieve, and perform actions 
on bookings such as canceling, requesting reschedules, or marking as no-show.

tags.name: Booking Calendars
tags.description:
Manage booking calendars and their availability. Booking calendars define available 
time slots for appointments and can be used to schedule meetings. Use these endpoints 
to list calendars, retrieve availability, schedule appointments, and create one-time 
booking links.

tags.name: Booking Pages
tags.description:
Manage booking pages for your account. Booking pages are public-facing pages where 
customers can schedule appointments. Each booking page is associated with specific 
event types and users, allowing for customized scheduling experiences.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description:
Manage contact information and relationships. Contacts represent people who have 
scheduled or may schedule appointments through your booking pages. Use these endpoints 
to list contacts, retrieve contact details, and manage contact records.

tags.name: Event Types
tags.description:
Manage event type configurations and settings. Event types define the structure and 
behavior of different types of appointments, including duration, availability rules, 
and booking forms. Use these endpoints to list and retrieve event type configurations.

tags.name: Master Pages
tags.description:
Manage master page configurations and settings. Master pages serve as templates 
that define the overall structure and branding for booking pages. Use these endpoints 
to list master pages, retrieve master page details, and create one-time booking links.

tags.name: Teams
tags.description:
Manage teams and team memberships. Teams allow you to organize users into groups 
for shared calendars, permissions, and resource management. Use these endpoints to 
retrieve team information and manage team-related operations.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
Manage user accounts and their properties. Users represent team members who can 
schedule appointments, manage calendars, and access the OnceHub platform. Use these 
endpoints to list users, retrieve user details, manage user accounts, and check 
scheduling availability.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Manage webhook subscriptions to receive real-time notifications for booking lifecycle events.

get.description: Enter your API key in the headers section below and click on "Try it" to test it.

message.example: The API key is valid for account: admin@example.com

value.message: Your account plan does not support API access. To use the ScheduleOnce API, you must upgrade to the Enterprise plan.

get.description: Returns a list all bookings in the account

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Only return bookings that have the given status.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: Only return booking owned by a user with a specific user ID.

parameters.name: contact
parameters.description: Only return bookings that were scheduled with the contact with the provided ID.

parameters.name: booking_page
parameters.description:
**BOOKING PAGES ONLY**  
Only return bookings that were created from the booking page with the provided ID.

parameters.name: master_page
parameters.description:
**BOOKING PAGES ONLY**  
Only return bookings that were created from the master page with the provided ID.

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description:
**BOOKING PAGES ONLY**  
Only return bookings that were created using the event type with the provided ID.

parameters.name: creation_time.gt
parameters.description: Return bookings with creation time greater than the given date.

parameters.name: creation_time.lt
parameters.description: Return bookings with creation time less than the given date.

parameters.name: starting_time.gt
parameters.description: Return bookings with starting time greater than the given date.

parameters.name: starting_time.lt
parameters.description: Return bookings with starting time less than the given date.

parameters.name: last_updated_time.gt
parameters.description: Return bookings with last updated time greater than the given date.

parameters.name: last_updated_time.lt
parameters.description: Return bookings with last updated time less than the given date.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: A comma separated list of fields that you want to [expand](https://developers.oncehub.com/v2.0.0/reference#expanding-responses). Possible values are `booking_page`, `master_page`, `event_type`, `owner`.

parameters.name: booking_calendar
parameters.description:
**BOOKING CALENDARS ONLY**  
Only return bookings that were created from the booking calendar with the provided ID.

parameters.name: host
parameters.description:
**BOOKING CALENDARS ONLY**  
Only return bookings hosted or co-hosted by a user with a specific user ID.

value.message: last_updated_time.gt cannot be later than last_updated_time.lt

get.summary: Get available time slots for a booking calendar
get.description:
Returns a list of available time slots for a booking calendar

> [!note]
> Notes On Using This Endpoint
> * All datetime strings are [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) in full form. For example, `2024-11-29T09:30:00.000Z`.
> * All datetime strings are in UTC.
> * The difference between `start_time` and `end_time` must be less than or equal to 30 days.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: The date and time from which to begin checking for available slots. If not provided, the system defaults to current time.

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: The date and time up to which to check for available slots. If not provided, the system defaults to one week from `start_time`.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the booking calendar

value.message: End time must be after the start time.
Time slots cannot be retrieved when the host doesn't have a seat assigned.
Time slots cannot be retrieved from an unpublished booking calendar.

post.description:
Book a time from the available time slots

> [!note]
> Notes On Using This Endpoint
> * This endpoint is designed to be used with the "Get available time slots" endpoint. First, retrieve available time slots for a specific time range, and then use this endpoint to book one of those slots.
> * You can only select a location from those offered within the available time slots.
> * This endpoint doesn't support booking calendars with required custom fields.
> * All datetime strings are [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) in full form. For example, `2024-11-29T09:30:00.000Z`.

> [!tip]
> Using Custom Fields  
> In addition to the standard fields, you can pass your own data by including custom key-value pairs within the `booking_form` object in the request body.
>
> * **Field Name (Key)**: The key for each custom field must exactly match the mapped field name of the corresponding question configured in your Booking page's form settings.
> * **Field Value**: The data type of the value must match the question's type:
>   * For Text and Picklist (single-select) questions, provide a string.
>   * For Picklist (multi-select) questions, provide an array of strings.
>
> Please note that for picklist fields, any values that do not match a pre-configured option will be ignored by the system during booking.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the booking calendar

start_time.description: The date and time of the time slot

type.description: Use `physical` for in-person meetings, `virtual` for online meetings, or `guest_phone` for phone calls.

value.description: For virtual meetings, specify one of the following: `google_meet`, `microsoft_teams`, `gotomeeting`, `webex`, or `zoom`. For phone calls, use the guest's phone number in E164 format. For in-person meetings, use the location's address ID (e.g., `ADD-1234`).

location.description: The meeting location object. This field is optional; if omitted, a virtual location will be selected.

value.message: The selected start time is not available.
Meeting cannot be scheduled when the host doesn't have a seat assigned.
Meeting cannot be scheduled on an unpublished booking calendar.

post.description:
Creates a one time link for a booking calendar

> [!note]
> One-time links are only available for published booking calendars.

> [!important]
> One-time links that haven't been consumed will be automatically deleted after one year.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the booking calendar

hide_url_params.description: When set to `true`, the API generates a short one-time-use link with no visible query parameters.

value.message: This booking calendar does not allow creation of one time links: 'BKC-1234'

get.description: Returns a list of all master pages in your account

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 30 objects, starting with `OBJ-XXXX`, your subsequent call can include `before=OBJ-XXXX` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 30 objects, ending with `OBJ-XXXX`, your subsequent call can include `after=OBJ-XXXX` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Determines the number of objects that will be returned on each page. Defaults to 10 if not specified and has a maximum limit of 100 objects per page.

post.description:
Add or invite a new user to your OnceHub account

> [!note]
> Notes On Using This Endpoint
> * The user will be added with Member role by default
> * An invitation email will be sent to the user
> * User limits apply based on your account plan (500 for purchased accounts, 30 for trial accounts)

email.description: Email address of the new user

first_name.description: First name of the new user

last_name.description: Last name of the new user

value.message: You have reached the user limit for your current plan. To add more users, please upgrade your account.

get.description: Returns the scheduling availability for a user

value.message: Invalid date format for overrides_start_time. Expected format: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the user

patch.description: Updates the scheduling availability for a user

value.message: start time should be multiple of 15: '09:05'
Date cannot be in the past: '2024-01-01'
Duplicate entry for day or date: 'Monday'
You can set either online_dynamic_link or online_static_link

day.description: The day of the week (e.g., "Monday", "Tuesday"). Must be a valid, case-sensitive day name. Duplicate days are not allowed.

working_hours.description: An array of time slot objects for the day. To clear all availability for a day, provide an empty array (`[]`). This field cannot be `null`. Time slots for a single day cannot overlap.

start_time.description: The start time of an availability slot in `HH:MM` format. The time must be a multiple of 15 minutes.

end_time.description: The end time of an availability slot in `HH:MM` format. Must be a multiple of 15 minutes and occur after the start_time.

type.description: The type of location. Valid options are: `in_person_by_host`, `online_dynamic_link`, `online_static_link`, `phone_by_guest`. Duplicate types are not allowed within the same slot.

id.description: The unique identifier for a physical address. This field is required and only used when the type is `in_person_by_host`.

value.description: The static URL for an online meeting. This field is required and only used when the type is `online_static_link`.

locations.description: An array of location objects available for the time slot. Can be empty. You cannot mix `online_dynamic_link` and `online_static_link` types in the same slot.

weekly.description: An array of objects, each defining the full availability for a specific day of the week. Any day provided will have its schedule completely overwritten.

date.description: The specific date for the override in `YYYY-MM-DD` format. The date cannot be in the past. Duplicate dates are not allowed.

start_time.description: The start time of an availability slot for the override date in `HH:MM` format. The time must be a multiple of 15 minutes.

end_time.description: The end time of an availability slot for the override date in `HH:MM` format. Must be a multiple of 15 minutes and occur after the `start_time`.

locations.description: An array of location objects available for the time slot on the override date. Can be empty.

type.description: The type of location for the override slot. Valid options are: `in_person_by_host`, `online_dynamic_link`, `online_static_link`, `phone_by_guest`.

id.description: The unique identifier for a physical address. This field is required and only used when the type is `in_person_by_host`.

value.description: The static URL for an online meeting. This field is required and only used when the type is `online_static_link`.

working_hours.description: An array of time slot objects for the specific date. To make a user unavailable for the entire date, provide an empty array (`[]`). To **delete** an existing override for a date, set this value to `null`.

overrides.description: An array of objects, each defining an exception for a specific date. Any date provided will have its override schedule completely overwritten.

Triggered when:
- Customer schedules a booking
- User approves a booking requested by a Customer

post.description: Triggered when website visitor stops interacting with a bot for more than 10 minutes.

id.description: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the event object

creation_time.description: The time the event object was created

api_version.description: The OnceHub API version used to render the data object

data.description: The conversation object containing relevant data associated with the event

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value.

id.description: Unique identifier for the object.

tracking_id.description: A unique ID automatically assigned to every booking.

subject.description: The name of the service or subject as defined in the booking form.

status.description: The status of the booking event. Can be: requested, scheduled, rescheduled, completed, canceled, or no_show

in_trash.description: The booking was moved to trash in the activity stream. While this value is true, the activity can still be found in the trash and has not been hard deleted yet.

creation_time.description: The date and time when the booking was created.

starting_time.description: The date and time when the meeting is scheduled to start.

customer_timezone.description: The timezone selected by the customer when making the booking. Displayed in IANA timezone format.

last_updated_time.description: The date and time the booking was last updated.

owner.description:
The ID of the owner of the booking. This is the User who originally accepted the booking, and remains unchanged even if the booking was reassigned to a new booking page.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=owner` to include the full User object.

duration_minutes.description: The length of the meeting, in minutes.

virtual_conferencing.description: The object containing information about the video conference in case of virtual meeting.

join_url.description: The URL to join the video conference meeting.

location_description.description: Information about the physical location in case of physical meeting.

rescheduled_booking_id.description: The ID of the booking that was rescheduled.

cancel_reschedule_url.description: URL for cancelling and rescheduling the booking. At the moment, only being sent out in webhooks.

cancel_reschedule_information.description: An object containing information about the cancel / reschedule event.

reason.description: The reason given for canceling or rescheduling a meeting.

actioned_by.description: The person who actioned the cancel / reschedule. Valid options are user (person in your team) and customer (person who made the booking).

user_id.description: If the cancel reschedule was done by the user, this field will contain their user id.

form_submission.description: The object containing information entered by the customer into the booking form. This will include any system fields and custom fields defined in your booking form.

name.description: The name provided by the customer in the booking form.

email.description: The email provided by the customer in the booking form.

phone.description: The phone number provided by the customer in the booking form.

mobile_phone.description: The mobile phone number provided by the customer in the booking form.

note.description: The note provided by the customer in the booking form.
note.example: I want to discuss whether your product can work for our office.

company.description: The company provided by your customer in the booking form.

guests.description: List of additional attendees (emails) invited by the customer.

custom_fields.description: The array containing custom Booking form fields.

booking_page.description: The ID of the booking page used to make the booking. **Expandable**: Use `expand=booking_page` to include the full BookingPage object.

oneOf.description: **BOOKING PAGES ONLY** Booking page ID (when not expanded)

master_page.description: The ID of the master booking page used to make the booking. **Expandable**: Use `expand=master_page` to include the full MasterPage object.

oneOf.description: **BOOKING PAGES ONLY** Master page ID (when not expanded)

event_type.description: The ID of the service selected by customer. **Expandable**: Use `expand=event_type` to include the full EventType object.

oneOf.description: **BOOKING PAGES ONLY** Event type ID (when not expanded)

conversation.description:
The ID of the conversation that this booking was scheduled from, null if the booking did not come from a conversation.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=conversation` to include the full Conversation object.

external_calendar.description: Object containing information about the calendar used in the booking.

name.description: The name of the external calendar to which the booking was added.

id.description: The ID of the external calendar to which the booking was added.

event_id.description: The id of the booking event that was created in the external calendar.

ics_url.description: **BOOKING CALENDARS ONLY** A direct, publicly accessible URL that downloads an ICS (.ics) calendar file for the booking.

allOf.description: Not included in booking webhooks at this time. If no UTM params exist on the booking, object will return null.

contact.description:
The ID of the contact the booking was scheduled with.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=contact` to include the full Contact object.

booking_calendar.description: **BOOKING CALENDARS ONLY** The ID of the booking calendar used to make this booking.

cancel_url.description: **BOOKING CALENDARS ONLY** URL for cancelling the booking. Only sent for bookings scheduled via booking calendars.

reschedule_url.description: **BOOKING CALENDARS ONLY** URL for rescheduling the booking. Only sent for bookings scheduled via booking calendars.

custom_fields.description: Any custom fields that have been added to the field library for the meeting object type on your account will be listed in the array of custom fields.

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

id.description: Unique identifier for the contact

creation_time.description: The date and time when the contact was created

last_updated_time.description: The date and time the contact was last updated

last_interacted_time.description: The date and time of the last interaction with the contact

owner.description: The ID of the owner of the contact

has_consent.description: Whether the contact has given consent

terms_of_sevice.description: Whether terms of service were accepted

custom_fields.description: Custom fields associated with the contact

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

id.description: Unique identifier for the object

name.description: The customer-facing name of the booking page

label.description: The internal label of the booking page

url.description: The URL of the booking page

active.description: True if this booking page is enabled and accepts bookings

timezone.description: The Booking page timezone. Displayed in IANA timezone format.

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

id.description: Unique identifier for the team

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

id.description: Unique identifier for the event type

name.description: The name of the event type

description.description: The description of the event type
description.example: Schedule a live demo with us for an in-depth look at our enterprise solutions.

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

id.description: Unique identifier for the webhook

api_version.description: The API version used for the webhook

name.description: Unique name for your webhook subscription

url.description: URL for receiving POST messages from OnceHub

events.description: Booking lifecycle events that trigger the webhook

creation_time.description: The time when the webhook was created

secret.description: Secret key for webhook signature verification

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value. The type here is booking_calendar.

id.description: Unique identifier for the object.

host.description: The user id / team id of the booking calendar meeting host. Additional attendees are not included.

name.description: The internal label / name of the booking calendar.

subject.description: The customer-facing subject of the booking calendar.

url.description: The URL of the booking calendar.

published.description: True if this booking calendar is enabled and accepts bookings.

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value. The type here is user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the object.

status.description: The status of the user. The user can have one of the following statuses - active or invited.

role_name.description: The name of the role associated with the user, for example - Administrator, Member, Team manager.

timezone.description: User's timezone. Displayed in IANA timezone format

teams.description: The teams the user belongs to.

has_more.description: Whether there are more items available

message.description: A human-readable message providing more details about the error

param.description: If the error is parameter-specific, the parameter related to the error

MasterPage.description: The master page object contains the name, label and URL for master pages on your account and indicates whether the master page is enabled to receive bookings.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value. The type here is master_page.

id.description: Unique identifier for the object.

name.description: The customer facing name of the master page.

label.description: The internal label of the master page.

url.description: The URL of the master page.

active.description: True if this master page is enabled and accepts bookings.

id.description: Unique alphanumeric identifier for the object. The prefix of the Conversation ID is CVR-.

object.description: String representing the object's type. Objects of the same type share the same value. The value here is conversation.

creation_time.description: The date and time the conversation was created.

initiated_by.description: Either bot (auto reach out) or contact (website visitor clicked on a CTA).

last_updated_time.description: The date and time the conversation was last updated.

last_interacted_time.description: The date and time of the last conversation interaction.

contact.description:
The contact / customer involved in this conversation.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=contact` to include the full Contact object.

owner.description:
The owner (user object) of the conversation.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=owner` to include the full User object.

status.description:
The status of the conversation. Can be one of the following:
- `started` - The website visitor has responded with a first message and the conversation is active from this point.
- `closed` - The conversation has been closed, this can be done by the conversation ending with a last message, or the visitor starting a different conversation.
- `abandoned` - If there is no response from the visitor for more than 10 minutes the conversation is ended in an abandoned state.

bot.description:
The bot that facilitated the conversation.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=bot` to include the full Bot object.

website.description:
The website this conversation was triggered on.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=website` to include the full Website object.

audience.description:
The audience associated with this conversation.

**Expandable**: Use `expand=audience` to include the full Audience object.

answers.description: Answers to the questions asked during the conversation.

id.description: Unique identifier for the interaction.

question.description: The question asked during the conversation.

value.description: The answer provided by the contact.

bookings.description: Bookings that are associated to the conversation.

UtmParams.description: Object containing captured values for the 5 standard [UTM parameters](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTM_parameters).

source.description: Identifies which site sent the traffic

medium.description: Identifies what type of link was used

campaign.description: Identifies a specific product promotion or strategic campaign

content.description: Identifies what specifically was clicked to bring the user to the site

BookingForm.description: An object containing information about the guest

string_custom_field.description: A placeholder for a custom field that accepts a single text value. Replace `string_custom_field` with the `mapped_field_name` of your Text or Single-Select Picklist question.

array_custom_field.description: A placeholder for a custom field that accepts multiple values. Replace `array_custom_field` with the mapped_field_name of your Multi-Select Picklist question. The value must be an array of strings.

id.description: ID of the deleted object

value.message: Your account plan does not support API access. To use the ScheduleOnce API, you must upgrade to the Enterprise plan.

Id.name: id
Id.description: The unique identifier for the resource

Before.name: before
Before.description:
A cursor for use in pagination. `before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list.
For instance, if you make a list request and receive 30 objects, starting with `OBJ-XXXX`,
your subsequent call can include `before=OBJ-XXXX` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

After.name: after
After.description:
A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list.
For instance, if you make a list request and receive 30 objects, ending with `OBJ-XXXX`,
your subsequent call can include `after=OBJ-XXXX` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

Limit.name: limit
Limit.description:
Determines the number of objects that will be returned on each page.
Defaults to 10 if not specified and has a maximum limit of 100 objects per page.
